item.title: IISER-K Course Material
item.description: Collection of useful material from my courses here

item.title: Philosophy
item.description: My thoughts on the philosophy that I have read
item.content:encoded:
The goal here is to put together a collection of (opinionated) notes on the stuff I read on my own, and at the Mohanpur Circle (Philosophy Circle at IISER Kolkata). I do not know much philosophy - so I will definitely be drawing from SEP and other authoritative sources a lot. Finally, this is not meant to be helpful as a guide (though, I would be quite happy if it turns out to be one someday). Rather, it is something that I can commit to building as I go along learning more. This will be organised on the basis of readings, and branch from there based on hyperlinks.

  • (Mohanpur Circle, 11-01-2025 - Present): The Ethics of Belief, William K. Clifford - Epistemology, Ethics, Philosophy of Mind, Psychology.

item.title: Semester 6
item.description: I wish myself good luck, once again
item.content:encoded:
PH3201 - Basic Statistical Mechanics

  • Week 1
  • Week 2

PH3202 - Intermediate Electricity and Magnetism

  • Week 1
  • Week 2

PH3203 - Advanced Quantum Mechanics

  • Week 1 (No Classes)
  • Week 2

PH3204 - Electronics Lab

  • Experiment 1: Zener Diode as a voltage regulator, Voltage Regulator IC (Not ready, yet)

PH3205 - Computational Physics

  • Worksheet 1
  • Worksheet 2

MA3201 - Topology

  • Week 2 (To be “found”)

MA3205 - Geometry of Curves and Surfaces

  • Week 1 (To be uploaded)
  • Week 2 (To be “found”)

MA3206 - Statistics I

  • Week 1
  • Week 2

Maybe I will someday solve assignments. When that day arrives, I prophesize that another day will arrive. This way, astute observer, I have not prophesized much at all. Neither have I solved any assignments, for that matter.

I only have these notes complete, here they are -

Typed up notes

These will only be updated until I realise I should just stop and study Analysis instead (I need to pass).
